note: Hydration query - returns consultant details and top 3 matching requirements. One row per consultant. MatchingScore and PricePerformanceScore are placeholders (0) - filled by app from Query 1.
columnOrder: ConsultantId, MatchingScore, PricePerformanceScore, FirstName, LastName, PhotoUrl, RoleTitle, EuroFixedRate, TotalMatchingRequirements, TopMatchesJson, TopMatches

fieldDescriptions.ConsultantId: Consultant.Id - the matched consultant's unique identifier
fieldDescriptions.MatchingScore: Placeholder (returns 0). Actual value from Query 1, mapped in application layer.
fieldDescriptions.PricePerformanceScore: Placeholder (returns 0). Actual value from Query 1, mapped in application layer.
fieldDescriptions.FirstName: From ConsultancyUser (if IsInternal=1) or ExternalUser (if IsInternal=0)
fieldDescriptions.LastName: From ConsultancyUser (if IsInternal=1) or ExternalUser (if IsInternal=0)
fieldDescriptions.PhotoUrl: DefaultPhotoUrlRound from ConsultancyUser or ExternalUser based on IsInternal
fieldDescriptions.TotalMatchingRequirements: Total count of requirements where consultant has Score > 0
fieldDescriptions.TopMatchesJson: JSON string containing array of top 3 requirements (ranked by partial_score contribution)
fieldDescriptions.TopMatches: Empty array placeholder for OutSystems structure definition (actual data is in TopMatchesJson)

topMatchesJsonStructure.description: Expanded structure of TopMatchesJson array elements

fields.RequirementName: Localized name via category-specific join (SkillAlias/RoleAlias/Industry/FunctionalArea/Language → LocaleDict)
fields.ConsultantScore: Experience.Score - the consultant's score for this requirement

topMatchesNote: TopMatchesJson is sorted by partial_score contribution to MatchingScore, not by ConsultantScore. A requirement with 8% weight at 4/4 (100% fulfillment = 8% contribution) ranks higher than 10% weight at 3/5 (60% fulfillment = 6% contribution).

appLayerMapping.description: After Query 2 returns, map MatchingScore and PricePerformanceScore from Query 1 results
appLayerMapping.pseudoCode: FOR each row in Query2Results: match = Query1Results.Find(r => r.Id == row.ConsultantId); row.MatchingScore = match.MatchingScore; row.PricePerformanceScore = match.PricePerformanceScore
